definitions.definition: a verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
examples: you asked for comments on the new proposals
synonyms: view; criticism "their comments on her appearance"

definitions.definition: discussion, especially of a critical nature, of an issue or event.
examples: the plans were not sent to the council for comment
synonyms: debate; interest "a great deal of comment"

definitions.definition: an indirect expression of the views of the creator of an artistic work.
examples: their second single is a comment on the commercial nature of raves

definitions.definition: an explanatory note in a book or other written text.
examples: note, annotation, footnote, gloss, commentary, explanation a comment in the margin

definitions.definition: a piece of specially tagged text placed within a program to help other users to understand it, which the computer ignores when running the program.

examples: the review commented that the book was agreeably written
synonyms: mention More"they commented on the food"remark

definitions.definition: place a piece of specially tagged explanatory text within (a program) to assist other users.
turn (part of a program) into a comment so that the computer ignores it when running the program.
examples: you could try commenting out that line
